title: Ferdinand and Isabella: Love and Empire
description: A quick win: understand Ferdinand and Isabella: Love and Empire.

hook.text: Their marriage united two kingdoms and funded Columbus. Ferdinand and Isabella's love built modern Spain.

buildup.text: Isabella of Castile married Ferdinand of Aragon in 1469, secretly defying opposition. Their union merged two crowns.

discovery.text: Together they completed the Reconquista, expelled the Moors, and funded the voyage that reached the Americas.

twist.text: Their partnership was pragmatic as much as romantic. They split responsibilities equally â€” rare for any era.

climax.text: One marriage created a global superpower. Spain's golden age began with two people choosing each other.

punchline.text: Ferdinand and Isabella's marriage built Spain and changed the map of the world.
